conclusion: Determine the farthest vertical distance from the wellhead water surface for a panoramic view.
The well has a depth of 8 m and a circular wellhead radius of 0.5 m. The refractive index of water is 4/3.
The frog is at the right center of the bottom of the well and wants to see the entire circumference of the wellhead.
The critical angle for total internal reflection is sin C = 1/n = 3/4.
The angle of incidence is sin^-1(3/4).
The farthest vertical distance is the height h where the light ray just grazes the wellhead.
The height h is given by h = sqrt(r^2 - d^2), where d = r tan(theta_i)/sin(theta_i).
